p: The cellular antioxidant assay confirmed the interest of natural antioxidant from plant extracts [ 18, 48, 49]. In the past decade, natural antioxidants have generated increasing interest due to their possible use as an alternative to potentially hazardous synthetic antioxidants such as butylated hydroxyanisole (BHA) or butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT) in various food preparations and their possible use as nutraceuticals [ 50]. Some natural antioxidants have already been shown to be as effective as these synthetic antioxidants [ 51, 52]. In the meantime, plant in vitro systems have been proposed as an efficient alternative for the production of natural antioxidants [ 53]. The present results indicate the potential use of an in vitro biological system as a tool for continuous and high production of natural antioxidants from Thai basil.
